results.title: Belonging to the group: respect as a human value
results.creator_credit: John T. Bobbitt and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Shows how an American family and a refugee family from Europe who move at the same time into a typical American community make adjustments and are accepted into groups at school, at work and at church. Discusses the need for people to respect and accept one another in a free society; explains the vital role of groups within a community; emphasises the importance of acquiring the feeling of belonging to a group; indicates community values and their relation to the democratic way of life.

results.title: Belly on fire
results.brief_description: Looks at the work of the Pigbel Foundation in counteracting and preventing the spread of the pigbel disease which affects the intestines of New Guinea villagers. Shows how the poor diet of the people, inadequate hygiene and the sudden intake of pigmeat during festivals combine to trigger off the disastrous proliferation of the pigbel organism, particularly in young children. Suitable for Upper Secondary level students. No other credits available.

results.title: Bells are ringing
results.creator_credit: Vincente Minnelli, Arthur Freed and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Judy Holliday reprises her stage role of switchboard operator Ella Peterson at the Susanswerphone company run by her cousin, Sue (Jean Stapleton). Ella has an uncanny knack of becoming involved with the lives of the Manhattan clients she services. One client in particular, a playboy writer know only as Plaza 0-4433 (Dean Martin), has developed a curious relationship with Ella, confiding in a faceless voice that he imagines belongs to a little old lady, not knowing that the young Ella has fallen in love with the voice at the end of the line. The police are suspicious of the Susanswerphone company and think its the front for a house of ill repute, thus Ella is also shadowed by a dim witted police official determined to get the real story. His pursuit of Ella blinds him to the fact that there is a real criminal on the loose (Eddie Foy Jnr), who poses as a record executive and uses the names of famous composers as a secret code for racetracks around the continent. Being the dedicated switchboard operator that she is, Ella takes it upon herself to protect the privacy of her clients from police scrutiny and delivers the messages in person (incognito of course). Thus she gets to meet Plaza 0-4433, aka Jeffrey Moss, in the flesh, and just in the nick of time too, saving him from wallowing in alcoholism because he can’t come up with an idea for a play. Romance blossoms between Ella and Jeffrey, but can it survive based on lies, and how will Ella reconcile her two personas? This was Holliday’s final film appearance. Adapted from a Broadway musical by Betty Comden, Adolph Green and Jule Styne.

results.title: Bellingcat: Truth in a Post-Truth World
results.creator_credit: Submarine, Hans Pool, Femke Wolting and Bruno Felix
results.brief_description: A first-hand look into the revolutionary rise of the “citizen investigative journalist” collective known as Bellingcat.

constellations_other.name: The entire history of you
constellations_other.description: Bellingcat is a journalism collective using social media platforms and surveillance footage for their investigations.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Submarine, Hans Pool, Femke Wolting and Bruno Felix
results.description: A first-hand look into the revolutionary rise of the “citizen investigative journalist” collective known as Bellingcat. Comprised of various distinct personalities from around the globe, Bellingcat is an online association of talented and dedicated truth-seekers utilizing advanced digital research techniques to upend the world of journalism. De facto leader Eliot and his fellow researchers give us exclusive access into their tight-knit world as they demonstrate the unlimited power of open source investigation. In cases ranging from the MH17 disaster to the hidden crimes of the Syrian regime, the group’s power and growing global influence is examined and explored.

results.title: Belles of the south seas
results.brief_description: Documentary travelogue view of the south sea islands and their native peoples. Includes Tahiti, New Zealand (South Island), Fiji, Samoan Islands, Papua and Kalabahi.

results.title: Belle epoque = Age of beauty
results.creator_credit: Fernando Trueba, Andres Gomes, Animatografia, Lola Films and Fernando Trueba P.C.
results.brief_description: During the Spanish Civil War, Fernando (Jorge Sanz), an army deserter, wanders into the sprawling property inhabited by a painter (Fernando Fernan Gomez) and his four free-spirited daughters (Penelope Cruz, Ariadna Gil, Miriam Diaz-Aroca, Maribel Verdu). Delighted to have found a brother in pacifism, Manolo invites the young man to stay on. His sojourn will be a succession of sunny days, shared friendships, and games of seduction as Manolo’s four daughters all vie for Fernando’s attention. This sexy film, a celebration of all the pleasures life has to offer, is illuminated by the beauty of the four lead actresses and a sensual photography. (Awards: Winner of the Oscar for Best Foreign Film in 1994) In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: Belle de Jour
results.creator_credit: Luis Bunuel, Raymond Hakim, Betty Edmonds, Robert Edmonds, Five Films and Paris Film
results.brief_description: Catherine Deneuve plays a beautiful young woman married to a rich young surgeon (Jean Sorel). Their life is a material success but the wife’s frigidity is a strain on the marriage. Plagued by masochistic sexual fantasies, she takes a part-time job in a brothel, hoping that by playing the part of Belle de Jour, the high class prostitute, she can overcome her dislike for sex. This is a savagely funny, and often a very cruel film, as it pulls apart the consumerist psyche of a bourgeois woman to reveal her as souless and empty of life. Stripped of her clothes, her jewellery, her status, she is a no-one. It is only as Belle de Jour that she can emotionally experience life. The movie moves back and forth from the casual filmwork of the brothel scenes to the surrealist dream sequences where Belle de Jour recieves the punishments she feels she deserves. Though often criticised as a misogynist film, it is not women who are the target of Bunuel’s satire, but the pretensions of wealth and status. Nor is the sexuality of men sacred for Bunuel as some of the funniest sequences deal with the absurdities of masculine desire. Co-starring Michel Piccoli and Genevieve Page. Based on the novel by Jospeh Kessel.

results.title: Belle
results.brief_description: BELLE is inspired by the true story of Dido Elizabeth Belle, the illegitimate mixed race daughter of a Royal Navy Admiral.

constellations_other.name: Royals
constellations_other.description: Royal watchers don't need to visit palaces around the world. There are enough stories about royalty on the silver and small screen to get their fix.

results.description: BELLE is inspired by the true story of Dido Elizabeth Belle, the illegitimate mixed race daughter of a Royal Navy Admiral. Raised by her aristocratic great-uncle Lord Mansfield and his wife, Belle’s lineage affords her certain privileges, yet the color of her skin prevents her from fully participating in the traditions of her social standing. Left to wonder if she will ever find love, Belle falls for an idealistic young vicar’s son bent on change who, with her help, shapes Lord Mansfield’s role as Lord Chief Justice to end slavery in England

results.title: Bellbird: Episode 205
results.creator_credit: Keith Wilkes, Oscar Whitbread and ABC
results.brief_description:
The ABC produced 1693 episodes of ‘Bellbird’ and the series ran for 10 years, until 1977. The series was a huge hit in rural and regional Australia because it dealt with the concerns of people living on the land and the dynamics of small country town life.
Episode 205 was broadcast on 1 January 1967.

results.title: Bellamy's Daintree: where reef meets rainforest
results.creator_credit: Australian Conservation Foundation and Wilderness Society
results.brief_description: David Bellamy shows how quickly our rainforests - the most diverse living system on land - are disappearing. He then catalogues the reasons why we should not be destroying our few remaining rainforests including genetic reserves retained in these forests.
